page.title: 09Public Houses.
page.content: In each of the villages there are public houses, all serving food. The King's Arms in Skirmett is an Inn with four bedrooms. Only The Crown in Skirmett and The Prince Albert at Frieth approximate to being locals. The Yew Tree at Frieth is a licenced restaurant, The King's Arms, The Bull and Butcher in Turville, and The Chequers at Fingest all serve main meals and attract a clientelle from a wide area. The Bull and Butcher is a favourite of the car rally fraternity, and currently the King's Arms is a venue for the younger set in that it provides live music -individual music- ians, groups etc., each week. The Yew Tree some fifteen years ago was a typical old English village local, then modernised and lately converted to a licenced restaurant.
